comments:
This is my first 5 Star rating!!The food was amazing. The server (Shalimar) was wonderful! The manager sat down and talked to us! It was a great time!The only negative is------ I live 1600 miles away
        Was this review …?

Bavarian Biernope...I had such high hopes for visiting this place. I had reviewed the menu before going and hoped they had even a little of the good German taste I grew up on with the German Sausage Festivals with the German Communities back home.  Sadly, I was seriously disappointed.The interior of the establishment is ok for a German/Bavarian Beer Hall. It is a bit more modern than the old world style I would expect from the exterior theming and the costuming of the staff, but it is light and comfortable for the most part.  The benches are a bit narrow, but that is ok.  The menus are straight forward and easy to order from, the selections fairly simple and not a lot to it. It's about what one would expect, and a one page menu does well here.To start, my friend and I ordered a giant pretzel with beer cheese.  The pretzel was indeed massive and more than enough for two hungry folks. The cheese however was lackluster, but the mustard that came with it was awesome. Kind of sweet, and fantastic with the good and soft pretzel.My friend ordered the Kasespatzel.  She said it was a safe choice and was ok.  She ate about half of it and got the rest to go.  She also ordered the beer cheese soup and also said it was good.  Her favorite dish however was the potato salad.I ordered the Bierhaus Wursteller.  I won't ever do that again.  I had high hopes and we both wanted to try the various sausages, plus the sides sounded good.  We were wrong.  We both tried all of the sides and the sausages and agree... the sides, all of them, were bland and almost flavorless.  The potato dumpling and bread dumpling were both cold and looked to have been scooped with an ice cream scoop. The potato dumpling was almost gelatinous in texture and congealed.  The red cabbage was bland, and the sauerkraut was terrible. A good sauerkraut is strong and bold... this was the complete opposite and I was afraid I was eating coleslaw instead.  Then there was what was passed off as sausages.  While they weren't so terrible as to inedible, I have honestly, no joking around, had better sausage from Jimmy Dean and cooked in the microwave.  There is no way one could say this was anywhere near authentic.  I know it was at least cooked in a grill since two of them were heavily charred almost to the point of burnt, but the taste was nowhere near my expectations or hopes.  For the most expensive dish on the menu... epic fail.We both ordered desserts hoping they would be the highlight of the meal.  To that end my friend ordered the Pretzel Pudding and I got the Strawberry Tort.  She indicated the Pretzel Pudding was good.  The Tort meringue was entirely too sweet and too hard. Though the strawberries were delicious.If, and that is a strong if, I ever come back, I am doing nothing but a beer flight or two and praying the beer is better than the food.  After spending almost $100 this evening for dinner, I feel we'd have gotten far better food from McDonalds, and I freaking hate McDonalds.  I'll give it two stars being generous because the staff was nice and courteous, but the food was terrible.
        Was this review …?

My friends and I were closing out a trade show and needed a place to get food and relax. We walked in with low expectations given we were told they only opened a few days before, only got their liquor license at 4:00 that day, and were a German place in Tennessee. Maybe it was the hand drawn traditional artwork along the walls, the staff in authentic regional attire (for Germany, not Tennessee), the menu full of amazing options, a great selection of beer simply priced by one of three sizes, or possibly the three guys on stage rocking out crazy train on a drum kit, upside down employed saxophone, trumpet, and accordion (yes, three guys - four instruments, you do the math) but we were floored. Staff was awesome, beer was awesome, food is literally something to write (or Facebook) home about. Go there. Repeatedly.
        Was this review …?

I celebrated National Pretzel the best way possible.  I visited Bavarian Bierhaus on their open to the public night and they met my lofty expectations.  German beers and restaurants are among my favorite things and this is the most legit place in the south east.  The restaurant has an awesome gift section, oompa band setup, German beer hall seating, German beer menu, and, of course, food.  The menu is very comparable to the now extended Hofbräuhaus franchise but with more beers.  The waitress and hostess were attentive, and the GM paid our table a nice visit.  For food the giant soft pretzel was baked as good as any Bavarian bakery.  I ate the schweinshaxe (pork shank) which was the best I've had in the states.  The wife had the schweinbraten which was basically a pork loin.  She was ok with it but other things on the menu would have been better.  She was a big fan of the apfelstrudel.  If you like German beer halls this is the best around.
        Was this review …?

So far so good,  I'm from Bavaria and had high hopes for this place and was not disappointed.  Food was fantastic,  we had simple things like obazta,  currywurst and leberkäse, the potato salad was great  (not my moms, but! Mmmh)  it was not warm, which that is good, not sure who came up with warm German potato salad, but that oerson should be punished! We will be back and try the haxn, roladen and schweinebraten. Can't wait!
        Was this review …?

Growing pains... I was in Munich last fall for October  fest, and if you come here to get a taste of that experience you'll get it. But they are working out the bugs that come with opening a new place, staff knowledge of menu and bar items were most noticeable. I have no doubt they will get it all worked out, I'll be back! The attention to detail inside is impressive.
        Was this review …?

Great food and beer, spectacular service, and live music! What else could you ask for! The Jägerschnitzel is amazing!! Even better with a LITER of Paulaner!
        Was this review …?

This place is amazing. Plenty of traditional German bier and amazing traditional Bavarian food with an American twist. Definitely a do not miss kind of place. If you haven't been, you're definitely missing out!
        Was this review …?

I went the night before opening, the German beer selection is incredible, the Weinerschnitzel is authentic. They've really done a great job re-creating an authentic German beer Hall. Lots of space for for big groups. I'm looking forward to seeing the changes when construction is complete.
        Was this review …?

Great food! Good beer! They are still working on kinks with service but overall good!
        Was this review …?

This place has GREAT potential. Authentic beer and food. Staff seems well trained. Performers are very talented... they do modern hits and classic hits with a German style. BUT! THE VOLUME WAS ABSOLUTELY OBNOXIOUS. I COULDN'T EVEN THINK MUCH LESS ENJOY THE COMPANY OF THE PEOPLE I WAS WITH. THE ACOUSTICS OF THE MAIN  AREA DO NOT WORK FOR SUCH LEVELS. ESPECIALLY THE DRUMMING (the all caps reflects how I felt the whole time). Honestly only posting this to help the staff and the business because they're right on track to be amazing! My party of 14 was very close to leaving and not ordering food because of the sound levels alone. Turning it down will prevent this.
        Was this review …?

The food wasn't that great.  Beer was good.  We had higher expectations for a flavorful meal.  It's a really nice restaurant though which should do well in this very touristy area.  Two beers, two meals, tax and tip about $72.
        Was this review …?

Noticed this restaurant upon leaving the mall last night. Had no idea it was there but then remembered some small indication of it while walking the mall. My nephew and I decided to try it and ordered the reuben and fish and chips. The reuben ($11) was very good and came with regular fries. The fish and chips came with steak fries which we did not like as much as the regular fries. I love fish but probably would not order this dish again. It was $15 and came with one piece of fish and a lot of steak fries. The fish was ok. Jennifer was our server and we found her to be very nice. We were told the restaurant opened last Wednesday. Unless you park in the side of the mall you probably would not know the restaurant was there. One suggestion I would make is to have better signage in the mall. The doors leading to the restaurant are just plan exit doors that the general public would not use anyway.
        Was this review …?
